thread.section_title: Phys.org - latest science and technology news stories
thread.title: Hackers raid Apple accounts via jail-broken iPhones
thread.title_full: Hackers raid Apple accounts via jail-broken iPhones

title: Hackers raid Apple accounts via jail-broken iPhones
text:
Apple readies security fix for Mac after iOS flaw February 24, 2014 
Apple said Monday it was developing a security fix for its Mac OS X computer operating system after a patch released for its iPhones and iPads to thwart hacker attacks. Apple iOS 8 software bug affects health apps September 17, 2014 
A bug in Apple's new iOS 8 software for mobile devices is prompting the company to withhold apps that use a highly touted feature for keeping track of fitness and health data. Apple pulls software update for iPhones September 24, 2014 
Apple has stopped providing an update to its new iOS 8 mobile operating software, following complaints that the update interferes with users' ability to make phone calls. New malware can infect iPhones via Mac computers (Update) November 6, 2014 
A newly discovered family of malware has the capacity to infect iPhones via Apple computers, posing a security threat to devices that have been largely resistant to cybercriminals, researchers said. Hackers could trick way into Apple gadgets (Update) November 10, 2014 
Cybersecurity firm FireEye warned Monday that hackers could trick owners of Apple gadgets into installing applications that steal information. Apple aims to boost mobile device sales with Cisco's help August 31, 2015 
Apple is leaning on Cisco Systems' Internet networking expertise in its latest attempt to sell more iPhones and iPads to corporate customers. Recommended for you Hackers raid Apple accounts via jail-broken iPhones September 1, 2015 
Hackers targeting jail-broken iPhones have raided more than 225,000 Apple accounts, using them for app-buying sprees or to hold phones for ransom, researchers said on Tuesday. New technique lowers cost of energy-efficient embedded computer systems September 1, 2015 
Electrical and computer engineers at North Carolina State University have developed a new technique for creating less-expensive, low-power embedded systems â€“ the computing devices found in everything from thermostats to ... Magnetic fields provide a new way to communicate wirelessly September 1, 2015 
Electrical engineers at the University of California, San Diego demonstrated a new wireless communication technique that works by sending magnetic signals through the human body. The new technology could offer a lower power ... Neural algorithm gives photo masterpiece-style treatments September 1, 2015 
Computer scientists are intrigued about what computers can tell us about artistic masterpieces, from picking out forgeries to assessing artistic worth. Butterfly wings help break the status quo in gas sensing September 1, 2015 
The unique properties found in the stunning iridescent wings of a tropical blue butterfly could hold the key to developing new highly selective gas detection sensors. Samsung unveils circular smartwatch, but are apps available? August 31, 2015 
Samsung is juicing up its smartwatch with a circular face and more battery life than the Apple Watch, but it's unknown how many apps will be available for it.
